availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Peter Wycoff (Mill Creek, Carroll County, Kentucky, saw mill owner.)

body.p: Mill Creek, Carroll County, Kentucky, sawmiller and farmer. Indiana native. Married to Amelia Wycoff, Father of Peter Wycoff, Amelia J. Wycoff, Windfield S. Wycoff, and Bennet C. Wycoff. Sawmiller in 1860 in Carroll County. Farmer in 1863 in Carroll County. Served as a private in the 54th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry from September 1864 to September 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, Mill Creek District 1, p. 140.
